titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Willie and Truman Teeter Collection
1956-2004
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Eva Guggemos
titlestmt.sponsor: Sponsored by a grant from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-04-08
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.unittitle: Willie and Truman Teeter Collection
did.abstract: Willie and Truman Teeter were a married pair of staff and faculty members at Pacific University, where they worked for many years. This collection consists of photographs, awards, yearbooks, publications and memorabilia that they collected through their connections to Pacific.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Willie and Truman Teeter were a married pair of staff and faculty members at Pacific University, where they worked for many years. Willie, also known as "Mrs. T," was a well-known and well-loved staff member at the Pacific University School of Optometry from the 1960s through the 1990s, when she retired. Truman was a professor of chemistry.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographs, awards, yearbooks, publications and memorabilia that Wille and Truman Teeter collected. Most of the material is related to their connections to Pacific University, such as awards that Willie Teeter won for her service as a staff member. Several issues of "The Optimist," the yearbook of Forest Grove High School from their daughter's time there, are also present.

Note: Cookbooks that belonged to Willie Teeter are cataloged separately, under MS.100. Yearbooks and runs of Pacific University publications donated by the Teeters were added to existing runs of the same publications in the Archives. Additional books from the Teeter Family were donated to the Pacific University Library for its general circulating collection.

prefercite.p: Willie and Truman Teeter Collection, Pacific University Archives, Forest Grove, Oregon.

acqinfo.p: Donated by the Teeter Family to Pacific University, October 2012.

userestrict.p: Pacific University owns the copyright to some, but not all, of the materials housed in its archives. Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Pacific University is retained by Pacific University and requires its permission for publication. Copyright status for other collection materials varies. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.p: Some student records in this collection may need to be restricted due to privacy concerns.

scopecontent.p: Includes classes of 1971, 1973-1993. Housed in oversized drawer 7.

accessrestrict.p: Due to student privacy concerns, this material is restricted. Please contact archives for information regarding access.
